issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
3. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
4. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
5. Tap to install
6. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
7. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

comment.body:
> When Disconnect is enabled, certain sites do not load. One in particular is Nextdoor. When Disconnect is disabled, the site loads with no issues.


The adblocker that you used an adblocker's report system for your issue is AdGuard. Not [Disconnect](https://disconnect.me/).

comment.body: @ghajini Thank you for working on this, but there is a misunderstanding regarding my report. First off, would it be possible please to revert the size of the middle `box containers` to their previous, smaller dimensions? Further more I notice that this element here... is removed or blocked: I didn't intend to report this specific element as the issue. I simply marked it with my red arrow in my screenshot to indicate `where` I was clicking when the `new tab ad` is triggered. Since these three clickable boxes are essential features for the page's functionality, removing them is counterintuitive, as it effectively disables the core purpose the webpage is designed for. My primary concern is actually only about the `new tab ad`. This is still active and seems to be triggered everywhere after clicking on the webpage. I didn't test for this beforehand, as I wouldn't have expected that behavior. Therefore, the main issue isn't resolved yet. I have attached a recording to clarify exactly what behavior I am observing and why I opened this ticket: [https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ed9122f1-6254-49a7-8567-15aacff84923](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ed9122f1-6254-49a7-8567-15aacff84923)

### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://www.google.com/search?q=%E6%B0%B4%E5%B9%B3%E7%B7%9A+%E6%AD%8C%E8%A9%9E](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3D%25E6%25B0%25B4%25E5%25B9%25B3%25E7%25B7%259A%2B%25E6%25AD%258C%25E8%25A9%259E) ### Comment > #223635 > `@zloyden` > > The problem persists in my environment (even if I update the filter, I can't copy it on the same page). I was able to solve it by changing the following user rules, so could you please check and add this rule? > > google.*#$#div[data-lyricid] { user-select: text!important; -webkit-user-select: text!important; -moz-user-select: text!important; -ms-user-select: text!important; } > > Thank you for always dealing with the issues on the Japanese site. ### Screenshots

```adblock
||sg.twatchu.com/*/js/otherad.js
/sg\.twatchu\.com\/js\/[a-zA-Z0-9-_]{50,110}\.js$/$script,~third-party,domain=sg.twatchu.com
```

comment.body:
Have you disabled the custom filter? What do you have in the filtering log? If that doesn't help, please do the following:
1. Leave only AdGuard Base
2. Open filtering log (FL)
3. Reproduce the problem
4. Return to FL
5. Export all
6. Send it in zip archive here.

comment.body:
我觉得有必要结束这场争论。我遇到了问题，我提出了问题，我指出的问题的根本在于规则太过主观不符合要求，然后我获得了什么——作者的辩解。他觉得他没错，那对，都是我的错，我花时间去查找解决我遇到的问题，花时间去提出问题，我不该这样做，对吗。我提出了反驳，然后我遭到了作者拥簇者的围攻，说我的反驳不对，然后开始找各种站不住脚理由。唉。。。我确实错了，我把开源社区想的太好了，本质上还是小圈子文化罢了。
@Alex-302 Please lock this issue as there is no need to discuss it further. Thank you

comment.body:
I just now tried to reproduce it and I discovered the following:

I couldn't reproduce the error with activated rule because I had deactivated it before. Once I cleared my browsers dns cache, brave adblock disabled and host on dns-level blocked, I could reproduce it in an incognito tab again.

Clear cache in brave: `brave://net-internals/#dns`

For Firefox, it should be `about:networking#dns`

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
>花时间去提出问题，我不该这样做，对吗。我提出了反驳，然后我遭到了作者拥簇者的围攻，说我的反驳不对，然后开始找各种站不住脚理由

没人说你不该这么做，是大家意见不同无法达成一致，前几天在群里发现管理说115更新屏蔽掉了我也不满，某知名规则也有这样的事例，但不痛不痒我就没说话。你有提出反驳的权利，但转而又说人搞小团体，发泄情绪人身攻击，这是对的吗？搞得跟我们还错了一样

issue.title: www.nikkei.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.nikkei.com/article/DGXZQOUC262LB0W6A120C2000000/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nikkei.com%2Farticle%2FDGXZQOUC262LB0W6A120C2000000%2F) ### Comment > This section contains the information, "This article is for members only, and if you register you can read the remaining 869 characters." While it's fine to not display the cumbersome member registration information, I believe that information such as the number of remaining characters should be displayed to users. If it's not displayed, users won't notice that the article is cut off midway and the 869 characters aren't displayed. ### Screenshots

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.nikkei.com/article/DGXZQOUC262LB0W6A120C2000000/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nikkei.com%2Farticle%2FDGXZQOUC262LB0W6A120C2000000%2F) ### Comment > This section contains the information, "This article is for members only, and if you register you can read the remaining 869 characters." While it's fine to not display the cumbersome member registration information, I believe that information such as the number of remaining characters should be displayed to users. comment.body:
@zwright03 Hi! I guess you meant [this app](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/espn-live-sports-scores/id317469184). If not, please let me know.
Do you still have it? If so, please try to update the filters and restart the app or you can reinstall it.

> Specifically, the “home” and “score” tabs on ESPN are blank

This is not reproduced with AdGuard DNS on my end. I see that you've used Private DNS. Please check that this domain `pinpoint.espn.com` is not blocked there.

issue.title: bato.to
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [http://bato.to](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbato.to) ### Comment > On November 19, 2025, the Shanghai Municipal Public Security Bureau in China raided the home of a man residing in the Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region on suspicion of copyright law violations. The man was allegedly operating the world's largest pirated manga site network "BATO.TO" (comprising approximately 60 sites including xbato.com, bato.to, and mangapark.io), which distributed Japanese manga translated into over 50 languages, including English, without the permission of rights holders. The man was detained (for questioning while in custody) and is currently released on bail. He has admitted to operating all these sites and is expected to be prosecuted. > 　The police have already seized the man's computer and are continuing their investigation into server analysis, the actual operations, and information on other individuals involved in the management. CODA has also confirmed that individuals involved in operating these sites and related social media accounts, as well as those involved in posting and translating content, are located in various countries around the world, and they plan to continue the investigation through international cooperation. > 　Regarding the site network operated by the man, they continued to operate temporarily after his detention from an evidence preservation perspective. However, subsequently, related individuals announced the shutdown on social media, and by January 19, the closure of all 60 sites was confirmed. > Ref: https://coda-cj.jp/news/2636/ ### Screenshots

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://accounts.google.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Faccounts.google.com) ### Comment > This is a copy of the message I posted today on the Telegram App asking for help about my issue that I have for a couple of years on most of my iPhones and iPads: “Hello, I have a question or two about the AdGuard blocking filters and the AdGuard VPN being disabled. I believe they are still working even if I have them all disabled, because when I try to log into my account on a few websites, I only get an entirely black or white screen with nothing written on the webpages. If you want screenshots of the websites that are not showing anything on the login page just ask for them. > > `@AdGuardSupport` > `@AdGuardSupport_Pavel` “ ``` Username: @FsAguard62 ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/lv0tzluxef44w8884sccsc80og8wskoefwgpwdi4j4.png?nc=1)

issue.title: bato.to

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [http://bato.to](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbato.to) ### Comment > On November 19, 2025, the Shanghai Municipal Public Security Bureau in China raided the home of a man residing in the Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region on suspicion of copyright law violations. The man was allegedly operating the world's largest pirated manga site network "BATO.TO" (comprising approximately 60 sites including xbato.com, bato.to, and mangapark.io), which distributed Japanese manga translated into over 50 languages, including English, without the permission of rights holders. The man was detained (for questioning while in custody) and is currently released on bail. He has admitted to operating all these sites and is expected to be prosecuted. > 　The police have already seized the man's computer and are continuing their investigation into server analysis, the actual operations, and information on other individuals involved in the management. CODA has also confirmed that individuals involved in operating these sites and related social media accounts, as well as those involved in posting and translating content, are located in various countries around the world, and they plan to continue the investigation through international cooperation. > 　Regarding the site network operated by the man, they continued to operate temporarily after his detention from an evidence preservation perspective. However, subsequently, related individuals announced the shutdown on social media, and by January 19, the closure of all 60 sites was confirmed. > Ref: https://coda-cj.jp/news/2636/ ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/peqb4j67bo0cwokoocwowwwog88ggkse9fuomremoo.png?nc=1)

The man was allegedly operating the world's largest pirated manga site network "BATO.TO" (comprising approximately 60 sites including xbato.com, bato.to, and mangapark.io), which distributed Japanese manga translated into over 50 languages, including English, without the permission of rights holders. The man was detained (for questioning while in custody) and is currently released on bail. He has admitted to operating all these sites and is expected to be prosecuted. > 　The police have already seized the man's computer and are continuing their investigation into server analysis, the actual operations, and information on other individuals involved in the management. CODA has also confirmed that individuals involved in operating these sites and related social media accounts, as well as those involved in posting and translating content, are located in various countries around the world, and they plan to continue the investigation through international cooperation. > 　Regarding the site network operated by the man, they continued to operate temporarily after his detention from an evidence preservation perspective. However, subsequently, related individuals announced the shutdown on social media, and by January 19, the closure of all 60 sites was confirmed. > Ref: https://coda-cj.jp/news/2636/ ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/peqb4j67bo0cwokoocwowwwog88ggkse9fuomremoo.png?nc=1)
